entry.title: digitalinnovationone/dio-lab-open-source
entry.summary:
‚ö†LEIA A ISSUE FIXADA! Reposit√≥rio do lab Contribuindo em um Projeto Open Source no GitHub da Digital Innovation One.

Contribuindo em um Projeto Open Source no GitHub

Reposit√≥rio desenvolvido para fins did√°ticos, com a disponibiliza√ß√£o de materiais de apoio para o lab Contribuindo em um Projeto Open Source no GitHub da Digital Innovation One.

Objetivo

Aprender o b√°sico sobre contribui√ß√£o no GitHub.

Ferramentas

Percurso

N¬∫ Etapas Materiais de Apoio
01 Introdu√ß√£o ao Lab
02 Formas de Contribuir num Projeto Open Source
03 Desenvolvendo e Enviando uma Contribui√ß√£o
04 Dicas e Materiais de Apoio

Desafio: Profile README

Contribua no diret√≥rio "Community", criando um Profile README contendo informa√ß√µes sobre voc√™ que deseje compartilhar com a comunidade. Para isso, voc√™ pode inserir: badges indicando suas habilidades; cards com suas estat√≠sticas no GitHub e projetos que criou, colaborou ou que deseje que outras pessoas colaborem. Al√©m disso, voc√™ pode inserir tamb√©m links para seus desafios de projeto e artigos na plataforma da Digital Innovation One.
Inspire-se consultando os exemplos na pasta community, confira alguns utilit√°rios na pasta utils e use sua criatividade para criar o seu üòäüíô.

Instru√ß√µes (PT/BR)

  1. Fa√ßa um Fork deste reposit√≥rio;
  2. Clone localmente: git clone https://github.com/SEU_USERNAME/dio-lab-open-source.git;
  3. Adicione o remote upstream para manter seu reposit√≥rio local atualizado. Por exemplo: git remote add upstream https://github.com/digitalinnovationone/dio-lab-open-source.git;

    Utilize o comando git pull upstream main para baixar e mesclar as altera√ß√µes no seu reposit√≥rio local com base na branch main deste reposit√≥rio original de onde voc√™ fez o fork, ou git fetch upstream main para baixar sem mesclar. Veja mais em: Primeiros Passos com Git e GitHub.

  4. Crie/Refer√™ncie uma nova branch e nomeie como feat/community/SEU_USERNAME: git checkout -b feat/community/SEU_USERNAME;

    Exemplo: git checkout -b feat/community/elidianaandrade

  5. Dentro da pasta community, crie um arquivo em Markdown (extens√£o .md) e nomeie com o mesmo nome do seu usu√°rio no GitHub;

    Exemplo: elidianaandrade.md

  6. Desenvolva o seu perfil. Para isso, voc√™ pode ver exemplos na pasta community e adicionar alguns dos utilit√°rios presentes na pasta utils;

    Observa√ß√£o: Use os outros exemplos como inspira√ß√£o e n√£o c√≥pia.

  7. Adicione suas altera√ß√µes a "staging area" com o comando git add community/SEU_USERNAME.md;
  8. Crie um commit e adicione a mensagem indicando a adi√ß√£o do seu perfil git commit -m"feat: add SEU_USERNAME profile";
  9. Envie as altera√ß√µes para o seu reposit√≥rio remoto git push origin feat/community/SEU_USERNAME;
  10. Crie um Pull Request.

Instructions (EN/US)

  1. Fork this repository;
  2. Clone locally: git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/dio-lab-open-source.git;
  3. Add the upstream remote to keep your local repository updated. For instance: git remote add upstream https://github.com/digitalinnovationone/dio-lab-open-source.git;

    Use the command git pull upstream main to download and merge the changes in your local repository based on the main branch of this original repository from which you forked, or git fetch upstream main to download without merging. Learn more at: Getting Started with Git and GitHub.

  4. Create/Reference a new branch and name it feat/community/YOUR_USERNAME: git checkout -b feat/community/YOUR_USERNAME;

    Example: git checkout -b feat/community/elidianaandrade

  5. Inside the community folder, create a Markdown file (extension .md) and name it after your GitHub username;

    Example: elidianaandrade.md

  6. Develop your profile: For that, you can see examples in the community folder and add some of the utilities available in the utils folder;

    Note: Use the other examples as inspiration, not as a copy.

  7. Add your changes to the "staging area" with the command git add community/YOUR_USERNAME.md;
  8. Create a commit and add a message indicating the addition of your profile git commit -m"feat: add YOUR_USERNAME profile";
  9. Push the changes to your remote repository git push origin feat/community/YOUR_USERNAME;
  10. Create a Pull Request.

Instrucciones (ES/ES)

  1. Haz un Fork de este repositorio;
  2. Clona localmente: git clone https://github.com/TU_USERNAME/dio-lab-open-source.git;
  3. A√±ade el remote upstream para mantener tu repositorio local actualizado. Por ejemplo: git remote add upstream https://github.com/digitalinnovationone/dio-lab-open-source.git;

    Usa el comando git pull upstream main para descargar y fusionar los cambios en tu repositorio local basado en la rama main de este repositorio original del cual hiciste el fork, o git fetch upstream main para descargar sin fusionar. Aprende m√°s en: Primeros Pasos con Git y GitHub.

  4. Crea/Referencia una nueva branch y n√≥mbrala feat/community/TU_USERNAME: git checkout -b feat/community/TU_USERNAME;

    Ejemplo: git checkout -b feat/community/elidianaandrade

  5. Dentro de la carpeta community, crea un archivo en Markdown (extensi√≥n .md) y n√≥mbralo con el mismo nombre de tu usuario en GitHub;

    Ejemplo: elidianaandrade.md

  6. Desarrolla tu perfil. Para eso, puedes ver ejemplos en la carpeta community y a√±adir algunas de las utilidades presentes en la carpeta utils;

    Nota: Usa los otros ejemplos como inspiraci√≥n y no como copia.

  7. Agrega tus cambios al "√°rea de preparaci√≥n" con el comando git add community/TU_USERNAME.md;
  8. Crea un commit y a√±ade un mensaje indicando la adici√≥n de tu perfil git commit -m"feat: add TU_USERNAME profile";
  9. Env√≠a los cambios a tu repositorio remoto git push origin feat/community/TU_USERNAME;
  10. Crea un Pull Request.

Utilit√°rios

Contribua

Este √© um projeto feito para a comunidade, ent√£o sinta-se livre para contribuir. Algumas formas de contribui√ß√£o al√©m do seu exemplo de Profile README, √© inserir outros utilit√°rios na pasta utils, ou melhorar a p√°gina de pesquisa dos READMEs fazendo modifica√ß√µes nos arquivos da pasta docs.
Al√©m disso, voc√™ tamb√©m pode contribuir:

‚ö†Ô∏è Resolvendo, respondendo ou indicando issues

‚≠ê Adicionando aos favoritos (star)

Membros da comunidade que j√° contribuiram:

Feito com üíô por Eli.

entry.title: PWhiddy/PokemonRedExperiments
entry.summary:
Playing Pokemon Red with Reinforcement Learning

Train RL agents to play Pokemon Red!

Watch the Video on Youtube!

Running the Pretrained Model Interactively üéÆ

üêç Python 3.10 is recommended. Other versions may work but have not been tested.

  1. Copy your legally obtained Pokemon Red ROM into the base directory. You can find this using google, it should be 1MB. Rename it to PokemonRed.gb if it is not already. The sha1 sum should be ea9bcae617fdf159b045185467ae58b2e4a48b9a, which you can verify by running shasum PokemonRed.gb.
  2. Move into the baselines/ directory:
    cd baselines
  3. Install dependencies:
    pip install -r requirements.txt
    It may be necessary in some cases to separately install the SDL libraries.
  4. Run:
    python run_pretrained_interactive.py

By default the game with terminate after 32K steps, or ~1 hour. You can increase this by adjusting the ep_length variable, but it will also use more memory.

Interact with the emulator using the arrow keys and the a and s keys (A and B buttons).
You can pause the AI's input during the game by editing agent_enabled.txt

Note: the Pokemon.gb file MUST be in the main directory and your current directory MUST be the baselines/ directory in order for this to work.

Training the Model üèãÔ∏è

Note: By default this can use up to ~100G of RAM. You can decrease this by reducing the num_cpu or ep_length, but it may affect the results. Also, the model behavior may become degenerate for up to the first 50 training iterations or so before starting to improve. This could likely be fixed with better hyperparameters but I haven't had the time or resources to sweep these.

  1. Previous steps 1-3
  2. Run:
    python run_baseline_parallel.py

Tracking Training Progress üìà

You can view the current state of each emulator, plot basic stats, and compare to previous runs using the VisualizeProgress.ipynb notebook.

Extra üêú

Map visualization code can be found in visualization/ directory.

entry.title: camenduru/LLaVA-colab
entry.summary:
üê£ Please follow me for new updates https://twitter.com/camenduru
üî• Please join our discord server https://discord.gg/k5BwmmvJJU
ü•≥ Please join my patreon community https://patreon.com/camenduru

ü¶í Colab

Colab Info
üåã LLaVA_13b_4bit_colab 13B (4bit)
üåãLLaVA_13b_4bit_vanilla_colab 13B (4bit) (without gradio)
üåãLLaVA_13b_4bit_caption_colab 13B (4bit) (without gradio - image caption loop)
üåã LLaVA_7b_8bit_colab 7B (8bit)
üåã LLaVA_7b_colab 7B (16bit) (Pro High-RAM üòê 22GB RAM 14GB VRAM)

‚ö† Tutorial

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o7zQAa0NPds

After clicking the third cell, please wait for the model to load.
~14.7GB for 16bit ~8GB for 8bit ~5 minutes
We will not receive any output because it will be running in another thread.

Main Repo

https://github.com/haotian-liu/LLaVA

Paper

https://arxiv.org/abs/2304.08485

Page

https://llava-vl.github.io/

Output
